models package¶

Submodules¶

models.location module¶

class models.location.Location(address, zipcode, name)¶

Bases: object

Represents a physical location and the distances to all other possible destinations from this location.

add_destination(address, distance)¶

Add a possible destination from this location.

Parameters

  • address (string) – the address of the destination

  • distance (float) – the distance to the destination

Returns

get_distance(address)¶

Gets the distance to a destination.

Parameters

address (string) – the address of the destination

Returns

the distance to the destination

Return type

float

models.package module¶

class models.package.Package(pid, address, deadline, city, state, zipcode, weight, status='At Hub', delay_time=None, req_truck=None, siblings=[])¶

Bases: object

Represents a package to be delivered.

AT_HUB = 'At Hub'¶
DELAYED = 'Delayed'¶
DELIVERED = 'Delivered'¶
EN_ROUTE = 'En Route'¶
PRIORITY_1 = datetime.time(9, 0)¶
PRIORITY_2 = datetime.time(10, 30)¶
PRIORITY_3 = datetime.time(23, 59)¶
advance_status(curr_time, truck_id=None)¶

Advances status of package to the next logical status and tracks the time the status change was made.

Parameters

  • truck_id (int) – id of the truck the package is on or delivered by

  • curr_time (datetime.time) – time of the status change

Returns

print_snapshot(time)¶

Prints a snapshot of the package in the state it would have been at the time specified.

Parameters

time (datetime.time) – the time for the snapshot of the package’s state

Returns

models.truck module¶

class models.truck.Truck(tid, time, start_address)¶

Bases: object

Represents a delivery truck and keeps track of the packages loaded on to it.

MAX_PKGS = 16¶
SPEED = 18.0¶
add_package(pkg_id)¶

If there is room on the truck, the package is added to the truck.

Warning

USED IN A PREVIOUS VERSION. NOT CURRENTLY USED. Use add_package_dijkstras instead.

Parameters

pkg_id – the id of the package to add to the truck

Returns

True if successful

add_package_dijkstras(pkg_id, pkg_dist)¶

If there is room on the truck, the package is added to the truck.

This version uses Dijkstra’s Algorithm.

Parameters

  • pkg_dist (float) – distance of the shortest path to the package

  • pkg_id (string) – the id of the package to add to the truck

Returns

True if successful

deliver()¶

Pops the first package off the package list and returns the package ID.

Returns

id of first package on package list

Return type

str

empty()¶

Checks if the truck is empty.

Returns

True if the truck is empty

full()¶

Checks to see if the truck is full.

Returns

True if the truck is full

last_package()¶

Gets the id of the last package to be delivered.

Warning

USED IN A PREVIOUS VERSION. NOT CURRENTLY USED. Use last_package_dijkstras instead.

Returns

id of the last package

Return type

str

last_package_dijkstras()¶

Gets the id of the last package to be delivered.

This version uses Dijkstra’s Algorithm.

Returns

id of the last package

Return type

str

peek()¶

Checks what the next package id is, but does not remove it from the truck.

Returns

the id of the next package to be delivered, None if the truck is empty

Return type

str
